medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 3 days prior to presentation. The patient reported persistent pain, inability to tolerate any oral intake, and vomiting shortly after eating. He experienced some sweating and denies fever/chills. Symptoms did not improve previously and he re-presented after initial attribution to GERD. No past episodes of similar symptoms were reported.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Coronary Artery Disease, previous CABG, Insulin Dependent Diabetes Mellitus (IDDM), Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease, Compression Fracture (T12), Diabetic Neuropathy, Diabetic Retinopathy, Dupuytren's Contracture, Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease, Hyperlipidemia, Hypertension, Nocturia.
